B

buy(int, double) - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method performs a mutual fund buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the mutual fund, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the mutual with no fee, adding it to the previous bookValue
buy(int, double) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method performs a stock buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the stock, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the stock with fee of 9.99, adding it to the previous bookValue

E

eportfolio - package eportfolio
 
equals(MutualFund) - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
Checks if two mutual funds are equal in terms of all attributes
equals(Stock) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
Checks if two stocks are equal in terms of all attributes

G

getBookValue() - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's book value
getBookValue() - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will return the current value of the stock's book value
getGain(int, double) - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method calculates the theoretical gain of a mutual fund (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 45.00 included)
getGain(int, double) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method calculates the theoretical gain of a stock (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 9.99 included)
getName() - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's name
getName() - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will return the current value of the stock's name

This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's price
getPrice() - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will return the current value of the stock's price

This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's quanity
getQuantity() - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will return the current value of the stock's quanity
getSymbol() - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's symbol
getSymbol() - Method in class eportfolio.Stock

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class eportfolio.Portfolio
Main methods for implementing all operations
MutualFund - Class in eportfolio
This class is used for the mutual fund data, containing mutual fund information for symbol, name, quantity, price, and bookvalue
MutualFund() - Constructor for class eportfolio.MutualFund
This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the mutual fund
MutualFund(String, String, int, double, double) - Constructor for class eportfolio.MutualFund
This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a mutual fund and sets these to the Mutual Fund object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value

P

Portfolio - Class in eportfolio
This class is used to perform different operations on an ePortfolio of stocks and mutual funds
Portfolio() - Constructor for class eportfolio.Portfolio
 

S

sell(int, double, ArrayList<MutualFund>, int) - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method performs a mutual fund sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of mutual fund owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes mutual fund PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which mutual fund was sold, and calculates the book value of the mutual fund remaining
sell(int, double, ArrayList<Stock>, int) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method performs a stock sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of stock owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes stock PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which stock was sold, and calculates the remaining book value of the stock
setBookValue(double) - Method in class eportfolio.MutualFund
This method will set the current of value of the bookValue to the double value passed in
setBookValue(double) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will set the current of value of the bookValue to the double value passed in

This method will set the current of value of the price to the double value passed in
setPrice(double) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock
This method will set the current of value of the price to the double value passed in

This method will set the current of value of the quantity to the int value passed in

setSymbol(String) - Method in class eportfolio.Stock

Stock - Class in eportfolio
This class is used for the stock data, containing stock information for symbol, name, quantity, price, and bookvalue
Stock() - Constructor for class eportfolio.Stock
This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the stock
Stock(String, String, int, double, double) - Constructor for class eportfolio.Stock
This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a stock and sets these to the Stock object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value
